713623f-a.text:
52nd Street, north side, from Eighth Ave. towards Ninth
Avenue.
October 22, 1927.
P. L. Sperr.

710216f-a.text:
Eighth Avenue, east side, north from W. 52nd Street. The 6th Avenue Elevated Line and its 8th Avenue station are on 53rd Street. Buildings to the right are shortly to come down. Construction of the Municipal Subway uuuder the Avenue (note the plank. ing) necessitated the sinking of a work shaft and a storare yard. Two bildings at 53rd Street will remafn. This will open to view interior structures that run through the block and which are the
skating rlnk and the Guild Theatre.
View 1: October 22, 1927
View 2: February 19, 1933
P. L. Sperr

ighth Avenue, west side, from 52nd to 53rd Streets, not showing R71 Eighth Avenue at the N.W. corner of 52nd Street. The station of the Sixth Avenue Elevated, gOing west over 53rd Street to join the Ninth Avenue line, cuts off most of the view of the

713621f-b.text:
West 52nd Street, south side, east from (No. 244) a point midway between Eighth Ave., and Broadway and across the latter, showing prominently the Alvin Theatre at No. 244. This set consists of a positive and a
negative view.
September 1935.
W.P.A. Photo.

713618f-a.text:
52nd Street, north side, west from Eighth Ave.
July 30, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.

710214f-b.text:
Eighth Avenue, north from W. 52nd St eet, showing the Sixth Avenue "El" running eastcrly and westerly on W. 53rd
Street.
The house-like structures thereupon is its Eignth Avenue station. This will be one of the fi st portions of this line to be demolished. Underneath same in the background appears
the Colum.bus monument in Columbus Circle.
The open parking 1ot at the right is at the N.E. corner of
this thoroughfare and W. 52nd Street.
Jan. 8, 1939
Views: 1-2
L. Sperr

710214f-a.text:
Eighth Avenue, north from W. 52nd St eet, showing the Sixth Avenue "El" running eastcrly and westerly on W. 53rd
Street.
The house-like structures thereupon is its Eignth Avenue station. This will be one of the fi st portions of this line to be demolished. Underneath same in the background appears

710217f-a.text:
Eighth Avenue, east side, north from W. 52nd Street. Demolition at the right was for the purpose of sinking a shaft for subway construction under the Avenue. This will remain vacant for years, though used as a parking lot. On 53rd Street appears the 6th Avenue Elevated Line a d its 8th Avenue station. 1939 will see the removal of this obsolete system. At the extreme left is the Columbus Monument at Columbus Circle. This terminates this thoroughfare. Central Park is
beyond that point.
Views 2 and 3 are limted to the 52nd and 53rd Street frontage. The Guild Theatre and the Iceland Skating Rink are east of the Avenue
and extend through this block.
View 1: October 20, 1928
View 2: February 19, 1933
View 3: March 30, 1936
P. L. Sperr
